snippet: Using “social impact bonds,” the innovative effort with Rikers Island inmates will be supported by a $7.2 million loan guarantee from the Bloomberg foundation.
abstract: New York City will allow Goldman Sachs to invest nearly $10 million in a program at Rikers Island aimed at reducing recidivism among adolescent men; investment is part of an innovative effort using 'social impact bonds,' with the financial services giant profiting if the program succeeds; New York is the first city in the United States to test such pay-for-success bonds; Bloomberg Philanthropies will provide a $7.2 million loan guarantee.
lead_paragraph: Using “social impact bonds,” the innovative effort with Rikers Island inmates will be supported by a $7.2 million loan guarantee from the Bloomberg foundation.
